segment.source: This article explains how to support the Share contract in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: This article explains how to support the Share contract in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: Share data
segment.target: Share data

segment.source: Share data
segment.target: Share data

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article explains how to support the Share contract in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: This article explains how to support the Share contract in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: The Share contract is an easy way to quickly share data, such as text, links, photos, and videos, between apps.
segment.target: The Share contract is an easy way to quickly share data, such as text, links, photos, and videos, between apps.

segment.source: For example, a user might want to share a webpage with their friends using a social networking app, or save a link in a notes app to refer to later.
segment.target: For example, a user might want to share a webpage with their friends using a social networking app, or save a link in a notes app to refer to later.

segment.source: Set up an event handler
segment.target: Set up an event handler

segment.source: Add a DataRequestedDataRequested event handler to be called whenever a user invokes share.
segment.target: Add a DataRequestedDataRequested event handler to be called whenever a user invokes share.

segment.source: This can occur either when the user taps a control in your app (such as a button or app bar command) or automatically in a specific scenario (if the user finishes a level and gets a high score, for example).
segment.target: This can occur either when the user taps a control in your app (such as a button or app bar command) or automatically in a specific scenario (if the user finishes a level and gets a high score, for example).

segment.source: Main
segment.target: Main

segment.source: When a DataRequestedDataRequested event occurs, your app receives a DataRequestDataRequest object.
segment.target: When a DataRequestedDataRequested event occurs, your app receives a DataRequestDataRequest object.

segment.source: This contains a DataPackageDataPackage that you can use to provide the content that the user wants to share.
segment.target: This contains a DataPackageDataPackage that you can use to provide the content that the user wants to share.

segment.source: You must provide a title and data to share.
segment.target: You must provide a title and data to share.

segment.source: A description is optional, but recommended.
segment.target: A description is optional, but recommended.

segment.source: Main
segment.target: Main

segment.source: Choose data
segment.target: Choose data

segment.source: You can share various types of data, including:
segment.target: You can share various types of data, including:

segment.source: Plain text
segment.target: Plain text

segment.source: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs)
segment.target: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs)

segment.source: HTML
segment.target: HTML

segment.source: Formatted text
segment.target: Formatted text

segment.source: Bitmaps
segment.target: Bitmaps

segment.source: Plain text
segment.target: Plain text

segment.source: Files
segment.target: Files

segment.source: Custom developer-defined data
segment.target: Custom developer-defined data

segment.source: The DataPackageDataPackage object can contain one or more of these formats, in any combination.
segment.target: The DataPackageDataPackage object can contain one or more of these formats, in any combination.

segment.source: The following example demonstrates sharing text.
segment.target: The following example demonstrates sharing text.

segment.source: Main
segment.target: Main

segment.source: Set properties
segment.target: Set properties

segment.source: When you package data for sharing, you can supply a variety of properties that provide additional information about the content being shared.
segment.target: When you package data for sharing, you can supply a variety of properties that provide additional information about the content being shared.

segment.source: These properties help target apps improve the user experience.
segment.target: These properties help target apps improve the user experience.

segment.source: For example, a description helps when the user is sharing content with more than one app.
segment.target: For example, a description helps when the user is sharing content with more than one app.

segment.source: Adding a thumbnail when sharing an image or a link to a web page provides a visual reference to the user.
segment.target: Adding a thumbnail when sharing an image or a link to a web page provides a visual reference to the user.

segment.source: For more information, see DataPackage.DataPackagePropertySetDataPackagePropertySet.
segment.target: For more information, see DataPackage.DataPackagePropertySetDataPackagePropertySet.

segment.source: All properties except the title are optional.
segment.target: All properties except the title are optional.

segment.source: The title property is mandatory and must be set.
segment.target: The title property is mandatory and must be set.

segment.source: Main
segment.target: Main

segment.source: Launch the share UI
segment.target: Launch the share UI

segment.source: A UI for sharing is provided by the system.
segment.target: A UI for sharing is provided by the system.

segment.source: To launch it, call the ShowShareUIShowShareUi method.
segment.target: To launch it, call the ShowShareUIShowShareUi method.

segment.source: Main
segment.target: Main

segment.source: Handle errors
segment.target: Handle errors

segment.source: In most cases, sharing content is a straightforward process.
segment.target: In most cases, sharing content is a straightforward process.

segment.source: However, there's always a chance that something unexpected could happen.
segment.target: However, there's always a chance that something unexpected could happen.

segment.source: For example, the app might require the user to select content for sharing but the user didn't select any.
segment.target: For example, the app might require the user to select content for sharing but the user didn't select any.

segment.source: To handle these situations, use the FailWithDisplayTextFailWithDisplayText method, which will display a message to the user if something goes wrong.
segment.target: To handle these situations, use the FailWithDisplayTextFailWithDisplayText method, which will display a message to the user if something goes wrong.

segment.source: Delay share with delegates
segment.target: Delay share with delegates

segment.source: Sometimes, it might not make sense to prepare the data that the user wants to share right away.
segment.target: Sometimes, it might not make sense to prepare the data that the user wants to share right away.

segment.source: For example, if your app supports sending a large image file in several different possible formats, it's inefficient to create all those images before the user makes their selection.
segment.target: For example, if your app supports sending a large image file in several different possible formats, it's inefficient to create all those images before the user makes their selection.

segment.source: To solve this problem, a DataPackageDataPackage can contain a delegate — a function that is called when the receiving app requests data.
segment.target: To solve this problem, a DataPackageDataPackage can contain a delegate — a function that is called when the receiving app requests data.

segment.source: We recommend using a delegate any time that the data a user wants to share is resource-intensive.
segment.target: We recommend using a delegate any time that the data a user wants to share is resource-intensive.
